content.text: You're at a 'borrel' (a casual drinks event) for internationals in Eindhoven. It's a great place to meet new people. A friendly local approaches you.

content.title: First Impressions
content.setting: A friendly Dutch person approaches you at the event.

conversation_flow.title: Tell him where you are from.

content.text: Cultural Tip: Dutch people are often quite direct. It's very common to ask about someone's job right after meeting them. It's a normal way to show interest.

content.title: Talking About Your Life
content.setting: The conversation continues. He's curious to know more about you.

conversation_flow.title: State your profession is {user_job}.
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ah, interessant! En wat voor werk doe je?

conversation_flow.title: Tell him you live in {user_city}.
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Leuk! Een {user_job}. En waar woon je nu?

content.text: To return a question, you can repeat the same question with 'jij' (you), or for a quicker response, just say 'En jij?' (And you?).

data.meaning: What kind of work do you do?

data.tip: The 'ij' sound is unique. It's similar to the 'ey' in the English word 'hey'.

content.title: Asking Questions Back
content.setting: You've shared a lot about yourself. Now it's your turn to ask the questions.

conversation_flow.title: Ask him for his name.
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ah, {user_city}, leuke stad! Ik ben daar soms voor werk.

conversation_flow.title: Now ask him what he does for work.
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ik ben Bas. Aangenaam kennis te maken!
conversation_flow.final_message: Ik ben ingenieur bij Philips. Leuk je te ontmoeten, {user_name}! Geniet van de borrel.
